forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear. Low around 42, with temperatures rising to around 44 overnight. North northeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. North northeast wind 3 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight, the air in Downtown San Francisco is crisp and clear, with a gentle chill settling in as the temperatures dip comfortably around 42 degrees and will rise slightly to 44 as the night deepens. The north-northeast wind, a cool whisper, drifts through the city streets, offering the kind of serene ambiance that invites quiet reflection. This tranquility is set against a backdrop of an ethereal calm, perfect for evening strolls along the waterfront or perhaps settling into a cozy café with a warm drink, allowing the gentle breeze to remind you of the slow-moving winter.

As we transition into Monday, expect a gift of sunshine, brightening the city with a tranquil glow. The high will hover near 57, and while afternoon shadows might usher in a slight coolness, the overall mood will remain cheerful and inviting. The lack of fog or marine layer adds a refreshing clarity to your surroundings, accentuating the iconic skyline and inviting you to explore the city on foot. To embrace the beauty of the day, light layers will serve you well—perhaps a well-fitted sweater over a casual shirt, complemented by a comfortable pair of shoes for wandering streets that seem to beg to be walked. With such pleasant conditions, an afternoon stroll through Golden Gate Park could prove as captivating as the city itself, where each turn unveils a new favorite nook of nature or art, waiting to be discovered.
